00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_pq.h -- A simple priority queue (which can be used to model multiple 
00023              clocks). From Cormen-Leiserson-Rivest, Ch.7.
00024 
00025   Original Author: Stan Y. Liao, Synopsys, Inc.
00026 
00027   CHANGE LOG AT END OF FILE
00028  *****************************************************************************/
00029 
00030 #ifndef SC_PQ_H
00031 #define SC_PQ_H
00032 
00033 
00034 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_cmnhdr.h"
00035 
00036 namespace sc_core {
00037 
00038 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039 //  CLASS : sc_ppq_base
00040 //
00041 //  Priority queue base class.
00042 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 
00044 class SC_API sc_ppq_base
00045 {
00046 public:
00047 
00048     typedef int (*compare_fn_t)( const void*, const void* );
00049 
00050     sc_ppq_base( int sz, compare_fn_t cmp );
00051 
00052     ~sc_ppq_base();
00053 
00054     void* top() const
00055         { return m_heap[1]; }
00056 
00057     void* extract_top();
00058 
00059     void insert( void* elem );
00060 
00061     int size() const
00062         { return m_heap_size; }
00063 
00064     bool empty() const
00065         { return (m_heap_size == 0); }
00066 
00067 protected:
00068 
00069     int parent( int i ) const
00070         { return i >> 1; }
00071 
00072     int left( int i ) const
00073         { return i << 1; }
00074 
00075     int right( int i ) const
00076         { return (i << 1) + 1; }
00077 
00078     void heapify( int i );
00079 
00080 private:
00081 
00082     void**       m_heap;
00083     int          m_size_alloc;
00084     int          m_heap_size;
00085     compare_fn_t m_compar;
00086 };
00087 
00088 
00089 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00090 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_ppq<T>
00091 //
00092 //  This class is a simple implementation of a priority queue based on
00093 //  binary heaps. The class is templatized on its data type. A comparison
00094 //  function needs to be supplied.
00095 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00096 
00097 template <class T>
00098 class sc_ppq
00099     : public sc_ppq_base
00100 {
00101 public:
00102 
00103     // constructor - specify the maximum size of the queue and
00104     // give a comparison function.
00105 
00106     sc_ppq( int sz, compare_fn_t cmp )
00107         : sc_ppq_base( sz, cmp )
00108         {}
00109 
00110     ~sc_ppq()
00111         {}
00112 
00113     // returns the value of the top element in the priority queue.
00114     T top() const
00115         { return (T) sc_ppq_base::top(); }
00116 
00117     // pops the first element of the priority queue.
00118 
00119     T extract_top()
00120         { return (T) sc_ppq_base::extract_top(); }
00121 
00122     // insert a new element to the priority queue.
00123 
00124     void insert( T elem )
00125         { sc_ppq_base::insert( (void*) elem ); }
00126 
00127     // size() and empty() are inherited.
00128 };
00129 
00130 } // namespace sc_core
00131
